item.title: Severe fly-tipping in fenced area next to electricity substation beside No. 4 Tower Road, 2nd January
item.description:
There is a large amount of rubbish, black bin bags, loose household waste, food packaging, bottles and other debris dumped inside the fenced-off area next to the electricity substation, directly beside No. 4 Tower Road. The waste looks like it has been accumulating for some time and is now spread extensively across the entire space. This is unsightly, poses health and hygiene concerns, may attract vermin, and is very close to residential properties. It also appears to be an ongoing issue rather than a one-off incident. Please arrange for the area to be cleaned and cleared as soon as possible, and consider preventative measures to stop repeat fly-tipping.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tower Road, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter and flytipping, 2nd January
item.description:
Litter and Flytipping up and down each side of Faversham Road. Bin bags, discarded bottles, cans and household waste. Yet again needs a thorough clean of the entire pavements, road and road verges.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Faversham Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of dead trees that are dangerously overhanging, 2nd January
item.description:
There are a lot of dead trees with loose heave branches making the area dangerous and unpassable. This area hasnt been maintained for many years but is now becoming increasingly dangerous but also is driving anti social behaviour. I am not sure if the area should ne maintained by the council or the golf course . The area is behind 20 - 28 Dene Avenue Sidcup Kent DA159LD.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hurst Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sheet of ice on the hill going down Tyron Way, 2nd January
item.description:
Sheet of ice causing cars to skid going down Tyron Way causing hazard to drivers and other parked cars. It’s used as a through road for many and many residents don’t feel safe driving out. The houses block the sun from getting on the patch of road outside the hill cause it to remain icy for considerably longer than other roads. Please can you ensure this road is gritted and is included in future gritting roads?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Tyron Way, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
